A psychosocial assessment is systematically carried out alongside the medical assessment.

A personalised safety plan is drawn up with the patient and their parents. This safety plan is a list of resources (resource persons, emergency telephone number, calming activities, reassurance techniques, etc.) that the patient can use before and during a suicidal crisis.

Involving parents in the care process is essential; they need to be made aware of the need for a safe environment (limiting access to lethal means).

question.title: What is the primary purpose of involving parents in the care process during a suicidal crisis?

option_a.title: To provide additional support and resources to the patient

option_b.title: To ensure the patient's safety by limiting access to lethal means

option_c.title: To educate the patient and their parents about the importance of a safe environment

option_d.title: To provide a list of emergency contact numbers and calming activities

correct_option.title: To provide additional support and resources to the patient
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
